intro: Isotrema feddei, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions with a deep root system and minimal water requirements. Isotrema feddei is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
